intro: Conostephiopsis minor, commonly known as the dwarf stephanotis, is a small evergreen shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, white flowers with a sweet scent. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a ornamental plant. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
